intro: Clibadium chocoense, commonly known as the Chocoan sida, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, heart-shaped leaves, and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
